com.gazbert.patterns.creational.builder.customer

Interface Customer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCustomer, BorrowingCustomer, InvestingCustomer, LoanCustomer, MortgageCustomer, SavingsCustomer, StockbrokingCustomer

    public interface Customer
    This is the complex 'Product' we are going to build.

    A Customer class hierarchy is: 

     Customer
           AbstractCustomer
                             InvestingCustomer
                                                SavingsCustomer, StockbrokingCustomer
                             BorrowingCustomer
                                                LoanCustomer, MortgageCustomer
    In reality it would be a lot more complex than this, but this will be enough for the demo!

    A Customer will have a different Account depending on what type of Customer they are.

    We's also use an Abstract Factory pattern for building the objects in conjunction with this Builder pattern - I'm leaving this out to keep things simple (?!) for now.

    Author:
    gazbert

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Account getAccount()
      Each Customer will have an Account.

    • Method Detail

      • getAccount

        Account getAccount()
        Each Customer will have an Account. The way the Account is built depends on the type of Customer we have.
        Returns:
        the Customer's account.
